name: Ecliptor
headline: AI and Embeddings.

founders.name: Andre Fu, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder & CEO of Ecliptor. I did Machine Intelligence at the University of Toronto, where I worked in deep learning research, publishing 4 papers in CVPR, ICCV and NeurIPS. Prior to Ecliptor, I did product at Microsoft, and ML at Twitch.

Former pilot, and top 1000 in Tetris. My girlfriend calls me the Michael Jordan of cooking.

founders.name: Nanki Grewal, Founder
founders.description:
Building cool things @ Ecliptor, as co-founder and CTO.

I got my degree in EECS from the University of Michigan (GO BLUE!!), where I concentrated in machine learning + system and product design. Before founding Ecliptor, I was at Twitch as an ML engineer on the Recommendations team, and prior to that I did internships in product @ Nutanix and IoT Eng @ GE.

When I'm not coding, I'm hiking, camping in my tent, and saving new recipes on Pinterest that I'll never cook.

Automate Complex Document Workflows with AI 
Parse, extract & analyze your PDFs and documents in minutes
Zero Data Retention, Fully deployable on-prem

### Ecliptor: Transforming Document Workflows with AI

Ecliptor is a promising startup in the realm of artificial intelligence, focusing on enhancing document intelligence and automating cumbersome workflows. Founded in 2023 and based in San Francisco, Ecliptor has the distinction of being part of Y Combinator's Batch W24. With a small but dedicated team of just two employees, the company is driven by the mission to harness AI and embeddings to simplify and expedite document processing.

#### What’s the Pitch?

At its core, Ecliptor offers a robust platform designed to automate complex document workflows, enabling businesses to parse, extract, and analyze PDFs and other documents with impressive speed. They emphasize zero data retention and fully on-premise deployment options, appealing to clients who prioritize security. 

Ecliptor operates with the philosophy of minimizing manual documentation efforts; they urge potential users to “never push paperwork again.” Their service is not just about speed; it includes a variety of features such as scalable infrastructure, advanced data security, and the ability to integrate smoothly with over 200 other tools. It's like the Zapier for documents, streamlining everything from PDFs to spreadsheets with ease.

#### The Founding and Team

Founded in 2023, Ecliptor's early-stage development is under the watchful eye of Nicolas Dessaigne, their group partner from Y Combinator. This connection to Y Combinator not only provides them with a network of fellow entrepreneurs but also critical resources and mentorship to navigate their growth journey.

#### Market Segment and Growth Potential

Ecliptor is strategically positioned in the B2B space with its focus on sales solutions in the artificial intelligence sector, particularly catering to businesses that handle vast volumes of documentation regularly. As companies globally seek efficiency and automation, Ecliptor’s solutions place them in a lucrative market ripe for innovation and expansion.

### What’s Next?

If you're intrigued and want to understand how Ecliptor can enhance your business document workflows, they are open for demos. For more information, or to dive deeper into their offerings, visit their website at [ecliptor.ai](https://ecliptor.ai).

In conclusion, Ecliptor is not just another startup; it represents a wave of innovation aimed at redefining how businesses interact with documents. Keep an eye on them—they're just getting started.
